description: This circular walk explores the wooded valley of Pleasley Vale on the Derbyshire and Nottinghamshire border. There's some lovely walking paths here taking you along the River Meden to the old Pleasley mills and a nature reserve. Here you can look out for a variety of flora and fauna including several different species of butterfly and woodpecker. You can then follow footpaths along Littlewood Lane and Northfield Lane to create a loop walk through the area to the south of the vale. On the southern side of the river there's also a cycle path along the River Meden Railway Trail which leads towards Mansfield .

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: You can extend the walk by heading west to visit the nearby Pleasley Pit Country Park. The park has some well laid out walking trails with ponds, reed beds, grassland and woodland to see.

display_address: Meden Trail, Pleasley Hill, Mansfield, Nottinghamshire, East Midlands, England, NG19 7RU, United Kingdom
